about:
Big Idea Ventures is the world’s most active investor in FoodTech - our goal is to invest in the best food technology and agritech companies globally. The company has contributed to the development of the growing alternative protein industry since its inception and has become a global leader in food innovation. BIV is backed by a strong network of strategic partners including AAK, Avril, Bühler, Givaudan, Temasek Holdings, and Tyson Ventures, and is partnering with governments around the world working on food security and new food ecosystems. The firm has offices in New York, Paris and Singapore and has invested in more than 100 companies across 25 countries. 

The New Protein Fund II invests in and supports the best alternative protein and ingredient companies both directly and through its accelerator programs. This global fund specializes in early-stage companies focused on accelerating the protein transition and specialized in plant-based, cell-based and fermentation-enabled food, ingredients and technologies. 

The Big Idea Ventures accelerator program is an intensive five-month program run out of the firm’s Paris, Singapore, and New York offices. The program assists companies in overcoming obstacles to effectively scaling a startup. This is accomplished by providing assistance from internal and external experts, corporate investors, and a broad network of mentors. 

To join our program or apply for investment, click[ here](https://bigideaventures.com/apply-now/).

about:
Investing in the augmentative era. The augmentative era describes the next computing paradigm that makes digital technology feel more human. We invest in extraordinary pre-seed teams building this paradigm by leveraging core technological breakthroughs to reshape how we work, play and socialize.
Our mission is to catalyze projects driving net-positive outcomes for the human experience, so our first criteria for investing is simple: will this technology enrich people’s everyday lives?

about: K9 Ventures is a technology focused [Pre-Seed](https://www.k9ventures.com/blog/2015/06/05/the-seeds-have-changed-an-epilogue-to-the-new-venture-landscape/) fund based in Palo Alto, California. We believe that extraordinary things are possible when great teams come together around technology. We primarily invest at the pre-seed stage, when the founding team is established and just starting to build the product, but we sometimes invest even earlier and have engaged with founders when they’re just thinking about the idea and haven’t yet incorporated their company.
email: We prefer that you reach us through a referral from a trusted connection who can vouch for you.
investor_names: Manu Kumar
investment_focus: Generalist
does_not_invest_in:
We want companies where the customers pay for using the product or service directly. In other words, “I deliver value to you, you pay me.” We don’t like three-way business models as at the stage we invest it’s impossible to tell a company will become the next Google or Facebook. As a corollary, we don’t invest in companies built on media, content, advertising.

We typically only consider companies where the founding team is located in the San Francisco Bay Area. This is not a function of where K9 is located, but because we believe that there is something that happens in Silicon Valley, which cannot be easily replicated in other geographies.

We welcome working with remote or distributed teams (a change in our thinking), but absolutely will not consider companies that plan to outsource the development of their core technology/product.

Incrementally-better solutions in crowded markets

Businesses chasing declining, not emerging, trends
Poor historical use of funds
“Solutions looking for problems”
Products that require significant investment or long runways before going to market
Winner-take-all outcomes

about: We founded Renegade to invest specifically in companies at what we call the Supercritical Stage (a nod to Roseanne’s prior-life as a chemist). A [supercritical fluid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supercritical_fluid) is at a phase where distinct gas and liquid don't exist. It has some properties of a gas and some properties of a liquid, but it’s neither and both at the same time. We think about companies going through a similar phase, where they are not quite early stage companies but they’re not yet growth companies. Like a supercritical fluid, they are neither and both at the same time.
investor_names: Renata Quintini, Roseanne Wincek
